alert.note: Alert for Smyth (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 4:17PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Smyth and southwestern Tazewell counties through 445 PM EDT... At 417 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Claypool Hill, or over Cedar Bluff, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Tazewell... Cedar Bluff... Bandy... Claypool Hill... Asberrys... and Cliffield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northwestern North Carolina...southwestern Virginia...and southeastern West Virginia.
